text.name: sys_description
text.text: 3DO is a company created by former members of Electronic Arts, partnering up with multiple manufacturers to produce their first console. These include Panasonic, Sanyo and Goldstar, each making their own version. The first console, the "3DO Interactive Multiplayer", came to market in April 1993. With a 12.5MHz processor, 2MB of RAM and two GPUs clocked at 25MHz, it could display 320x240 pixels in 16 million colors. It is considered slightly less powerful than its competitors (the Saturn and PS1) and has a few notable titles.
